lines.text: You really got the itch, ain't ya?
Well, yeah, I do. I guess all I want to do is punch cows and ride and, well, just cowboying. There's nothing better than that. That's all I want.
Kid, cowboying is something you do when you can't do nothing else.
Sure is a nice horse. What's his name?
You don't have to put a name on something you might have to eat.
How come they keep calling me 'Little Mary'?
That's your name, kid. What's the matter? Don't you like it?
No, I don't. It's a girl's name.
Well, that's what they call the cook's helper... Little Mary. Christ, I wish you was a girl.
I want to go with you, Mr. Culpepper. I ride real good and I can do a lot of things. I mean, I'll work at almost anything, Mr. Culpepper. I really want to go.
Because I want to be a cowboy more than anything, Mr. Culpepper.
Well, that's one hell of an ambition, boy.
The best part is getting into town or getting out of town. In between is lousy.
Don't turn your back on me, mister!
Don't let your mouth overload your hardware, cowboy.
